title: Regular Eye Exams
description: Glaucoma often has no symptoms in its early stages, so regular eye exams are crucial to monitor any changes in eye pressure and the condition of the optic nerve.
recommendation: Schedule comprehensive eye exams at least once a year or as advised by the ophthalmologist.

title: Medications & Treatment
description: Glaucoma is typically managed with medication that lowers eye pressure, such as eye drops.
recommendation: Always use prescribed eye drops as directed by the doctor. Do not skip doses or discontinue medication without consulting the doctor.

title: Monitor Eye Pressure
description: Eye pressure control is essential in managing glaucoma and preventing vision loss.
recommendation: If prescribed, use devices or visit eye clinics regularly to check your eye pressure and ensure it stays within a safe range.

title: Protect Eyes from Injury
description: Any trauma to the eye can exacerbate glaucoma or damage vision further.
recommendation: Wear protective eyewear when participating in sports, using tools, or in situations where the eyes may be at risk of injury.

title: Healthy Lifestyle
description: A balanced diet, regular exercise, and maintaining a healthy weight can help reduce eye pressure and improve overall eye health.
recommendation: Maintain a healthy diet rich in antioxidants, omega-3 fatty acids, and vitamins like A, C, and E. Engage in regular physical activity like walking or swimming.

title: Limit Caffeine Intake
description: Excessive caffeine consumption may increase intraocular pressure (IOP) in some individuals, which can worsen glaucoma.
recommendation: Limit caffeinated beverages to moderate levels and avoid consuming excessive amounts of coffee or energy drinks.

title: Avoid Smoking
description: Smoking can worsen blood circulation to the optic nerve and may increase the risk of developing glaucoma.
recommendation: If you smoke, consider quitting, and avoid exposure to secondhand smoke.

title: Be Mindful of Eye Strain
description: Prolonged screen time or reading in poor lighting can strain the eyes and exacerbate symptoms of glaucoma.
recommendation: Take breaks every 20 minutes while using screens (following the 20-20-20 rule), and ensure proper lighting when reading or working.

title: Stay Hydrated
description: Dehydration can increase eye pressure and impact eye health.
recommendation: Drink plenty of water throughout the day to maintain hydration, but avoid excessive fluid intake in one go.

title: Monitor Blood Pressure
description: High blood pressure and poor circulation can affect eye health and may exacerbate glaucoma.
recommendation: Regularly monitor your blood pressure and work with your healthcare provider to maintain a healthy range.

title: Rest and Sleep
description: Adequate sleep helps to reduce overall stress and eye strain.
recommendation: Aim for 7-8 hours of quality sleep each night, and avoid staying in one position for too long.

title: Seek Immediate Medical Help if Symptoms Worsen
description: If there are sudden changes in vision or increased eye pain, this could indicate a serious issue.
recommendation: Seek emergency medical attention if you experience blurry vision, sudden loss of vision, nausea, or severe headaches.

title: Educational Resources
description: Understanding the condition can empower patients to manage it better.
recommendation: Direct users to trusted educational resources or support groups where they can learn more about glaucoma management, and connect with others facing similar challenges.
